definition: to float in the air/swiftly/nimbly/easy and relaxed
elated/light and airy feeling (after a few drinks)/smug and conceited/complacent

sentences.english: The chilly winter is far away and the spring is coming on.
sentences.chinese: 萧索寒冬渐已远去，春天飘然而至。

sentences.english: The dancers glided across the floor.
sentences.chinese: 跳舞的人在地板上飘然而过。

sentences.english: April, come she will, when streams are rip and swelled with rain.
sentences.chinese: 四月，春潮带雨袭来之时，她挟一段爱飘然而至。

sentences.english: The snow decorated the car with a new look.
sentences.chinese: 飘然而至的雪花把这辆汽车重新雕塑了一番。

sentences.english: Distance produce beauty of soliciting, floating in the air.
sentences.chinese: 距离产生美感，飘然引人遐思。

sentences.english: If done correctly, the fluttering sensation will match the one in your heart.
sentences.chinese: 如果做得对，那飘然的感觉会相印在你们的心。

sentences.english: Telegraph poles are blurry, not so much pacing out the landscape as shimmying across it.
sentences.chinese: 模糊的电线杆无法在踩着狐步飘然而过时量出画面。

sentences.english: Man, you have been walking on air for days.
sentences.chinese: 伙计，你最近这几天都一副飘飘然的样子。

sentences.english: Then, after a stretch arms and body like a goddess with a veil floating in the air over the region.
sentences.chinese: 于是一个两臂后伸，身带披纱的女神像飘然而至。

sentences.english: Don't make a woman's compliment, but often make men grow weary.
sentences.chinese: 恭维不会使女人飘然，却往往使男人丧志。

sentences.english: The souls of a billion Chinese people are floating in the air.
sentences.chinese: 十亿中国人民的灵魂飘然若空。

sentences.english: I think he's secretly revelling in all the attention.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得他对于能够引起广泛的注意心里感到飘飘然。

sentences.english: Says Mr. Goldsmith: 'Strong leaders don't coast.'
sentences.chinese: 戈德史密斯说，强有力的领导人不会飘飘然。

sentences.english: He finally drifted in half an hour after everyone else.
sentences.chinese: 他终于飘然而至，比别人迟到了半个钟头。

sentences.english: She breezed out without paying attention to anyone.
sentences.chinese: 她不理睬任何人，飘然而去。

definition: to float about/to flutter (in the breeze)/(dialect) gay guy/(Tw) ghost
to fly up/to dance in the air (of snowflakes, flower petals etc)
(of a breeze) to make (hair, leaves, clothing etc) sway gently/to ruffle
to float down/to fall gently (snowflakes, leaves etc)
